description: Sports mascots bounce around in extremely hot weather all the time. There has got to be something we can learn from those guys as to how we can keep people in suits cool that can be both inexpensive and deployed quickly.
summary: Can we use the cooling systems similar to what is located inside the heads of sports mascots? It isn't going to cure the disease but if we can keep the healthcare workers a little cooler while in those protective suits then they will be less likely to make mistakes when removing the suit or during their medical work. They will also be more willing to be patient when removing the protective clothing. These things are small, light weight, and battery powered. Maybe it could be attached to the standard PPE in a way that would keep it sealed and able to be removed for use with multiple PPEs??
title: Mascot Cooling System
